QuestionStatement: Assume that the aggregate supply curve is upward sloping. If both aggregate supply and aggregate demand increase, what will happen to the equilibrium output and price level?       Output                 Price Levela.      Decrease            Decreaseb.      Decrease            Increasec.      Indeterminate     Increased.      Increase              Indeterminatee.      Increase              Increase

According to the graph above and starting with equilibrium point R, which of the following shifts identifies the short-run and the long-run impact of a demand-pull inflation?Short Run                Long Runa.      R to N            M to Nb.      R to M            R to Nc.      R to Q            Q to Nd.      R to M            R to Qe.      R to N            N to Q

Assume that the marginal propensity to consume out of disposable income is 0.8 and that the government taxes all income at a constant rate of 30 percent. If gross income increases by $100, consumption will initially increase by
Which of the following is true of the Phillips curve?
AnswerChoices: It is vertical in the short run, but is upward sloping in the long run
It is upward sloping in the short run, but is downward sloping in the long run
It is downward sloping in the short run, but is vertical in the long run
It shows trade-offs between unemployment and inflation in the long run but not in the short run
It is upward sloping both in the short run and in the long run if inflation is anticipated correctly

QuestionStatement: If wages and prices are perfectly flexible and inflation is correctly anticipated, then an expansionary monetary policy will affect the real output and price level in which of the following ways?                Real Output          Price Levela.      Increase            Increaseb.      Increase            Decreasec.      Increase            Not changed.      Not change       Increasee.      Not change        Not change
According to the graph above, an increase in aggregate supply will most likely cause income and employment to change in which of the following ways?
Which of the following would indicate that economic growth has occurred?
AnswerChoices: The production possibilities curve shifts to the left
The long-run aggregate supply curve shifts to the right
The aggregate demand curve shifts to the right

QuestionStatement: Crowding out refers to the decrease in
AnswerChoices: National output caused by higher taxes
Domestic production caused by increased imports
Private investment due to increased borrowing by the government
Exports caused by an appreciating currency of a country

A short-run Phillips curve shows an inverse relationship between
Stagflation is most likely to be caused by
AnswerChoices: A large increase in the money supply

QuestionStatement: An advance in technology will cause the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve to shift the right
Aggregate demand curve to shift to the left
Short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left
Long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the left

QuestionStatement: According to the graph above, which of the following is true about the long-run equilibrium of the economy depicted?
AnswerChoices: The economy is in long-run equilibrium
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the left to restore long-run equilibrium
The long-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right to restore long-run equilibrium
Without fiscal policy stimulus, the economy will remain in a recession
As wages increase, the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the left to restore long-run equilibrium

QuestionStatement: An increase in personal income taxes will most likely cause aggregate demand and aggregate supply to change in which of the following ways in the short run?
Which of the following is true about the marginal propensity to consume?
AnswerChoices: It is the percentage of total income that is spent on consumption
It determines the size of the simple spending multiplier
It increases as incomes increase because increases in income cause people to spend more
It is the same as the money multiplier
It is equal to the average propensity to consume for people with low incomes

A decrease in labor productivity will shift the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve to the right
Aggregate demand curve to the left
Long-run aggregate supply curve to the right

QuestionStatement: An increase in aggregate demand will cause which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A movement along a given-short run Phillips curve
The long-run Phillips curve to become horizontal
The short-run Phillips curve to shift to the left
The long-run Phillips curve to shift to the right
The long-run Phillips curve to shift to the left

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would cause the short-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right?
AnswerChoices: An increase in the wage rate
An increase in the interest rate
An increase in the natural rate of unemployment
A decrease in the capital stock
A decrease in the expected price level

QuestionStatement: A decrease in business taxes would lead to an increase in national income by increasing which of the following?
AnswerChoices: Both aggregate demand and aggregate supply

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would most likely lead to a decrease in aggregate demand, that is, shift the aggregate demand curve leftward?
AnswerChoices: An increase in business firms’ purchases of capital equipment from retained earnings

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian model, equilibrium output of an economy may be less than the full-employment level of output because at full employment
AnswerChoices: Sufficient income may or may not be generated to keep workers above the subsistence levels
There might not be enough demand by firms and consumers to buy that output
Workers may not be willing to work the hours necessary to produce the output
Interest rates might not be high enough to provide the incentive to finance the production
Banks may not be willing to lend enough money to support output
